title: Bottoms up! Citi in pitcher for KKR's pubs
text:
Citigroup's investment bankers have been asked to carry the drinks for KKR-backed pubs group Australian Venue Co as it prepares a debt raising and likely strategic review.

Street Talk can reveal Australian Venue Co has tapped Citi to help drum up interest among lending banks and credit investors, with the company requiring some additional funds following a spate of acquisitions.

Former Mantra chief executive Bob East is now chairman at KKR's Australian Venue Co. Luis Ascui

Citi's mandate is expected to stretch to a strategic review early in the new year, which would consider exit options for the pubs group's biggest investor KKR and other shareholders. The minority investors include former Spotless Group and Healthscope boss Bruce Dixon and the company's management team.

Citi's bankers are expected to be in the market to help fill Australian Venue Co's funding needs in coming weeks. According to Bloomberg data the company already has loans worth $380 million, which are due to mature in September 2022.

The search for additional debt comes after a busy period for Australian Venue Co.
description: Citigroup has been asked to carry the drinks for pubs group Australian Venue.
